results.byline: By Campbell Robertson and Ernesto Londoño
results.title: G.O.P. Lawmakers Override Kentucky Governor’s Veto on Anti-Trans Law
results.abstract: The Kentucky measure bans access to gender-transition care for young people, and West Virginia’s governor signed a similar bill on Wednesday. Passage of bans also appears imminent in Idaho and Missouri.

media.caption: State Senator Max Wise spoke during a news conference on Wednesday in support of S.B. 150 in Frankfort, Ky.
media.copyright: Jon Cherry/Getty Images

results.abstract: At the celebrity ski trial of the century, Ms. Paltrow can’t deny her own profile, but she can’t fully lean into it either.

media.caption: Gwyneth Paltrow in court on the second day of the trial.
media.copyright: Pool photo by Rick Bowmer

results.title: Disney Lays Off Ike Perlmutter, Chairman of Marvel Entertainment
results.abstract: The move, part of a cost-cutting campaign, followed Mr. Perlmutter’s unsuccessful effort to shake up Disney’s board.

media.caption: Isaac Perlmutter sold Marvel to Disney in 2009 for $4 billion.

results.title: Republicans Face Setbacks in Push to Tighten Voting Laws on College Campuses
results.abstract: Party officials across the country have sought to erect more barriers for young voters, who tilt heavily Democratic, after several cycles in which their turnout surged.

media.caption: Students walking between classes at the University of Idaho. The state will ban student ID cards as a form of voter identification, one of few successes for Republicans targeting young voters this year.
media.copyright: Rajah Bose for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Decisions and Verdicts;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;False Arrests, Convictions and Imprisonments;Syed, Adnan;Lee, Hae Min (1980-99);Maryland;Baltimore (Md)
results.byline: By Michael Levenson and Abbie VanSickle
results.title: Court Reinstates Adnan Syed’s Murder Conviction in ‘Serial’ Case and Orders New Hearing
results.abstract: The Appellate Court of Maryland ruled that a lower court had violated the right of the victim’s brother to have been notified of and to attend a hearing.

media.caption: Adnan Syed walked out of the Baltimore City Circuit Court on Sept. 19 after a judge overturned his conviction. He had served 23 years in prison.
media.copyright: Ting Shen for The New York Times

results.title: What We Know About the Nashville School Shooting
results.abstract: Investigators were still searching for a motive in the killing of six people at the Covenant School. The police said the assailant was being treated for an emotional disorder.

results.abstract: More than 1,000 tech leaders, researchers and others signed an open letter urging a moratorium on the development of the most powerful artificial intelligence systems.

results.title: Can New York Fix Its Housing Crisis? It Depends on the Suburbs
results.abstract: The governor’s quest, to force suburbs around New York City to build more housing, is meeting with resistance.

results.title: To Die on Her Own Terms, a Connecticut Woman Turns to Vermont
results.abstract: Connecticut does not allow medical aid in dying, so Lynda Bluestein sued Vermont to take advantage of that state’s law. Now, legislators may make the practice more broadly available.

media.caption: Lynda Bluestein of Bridgeport, Conn., reached a settlement with Vermont to become the first nonresident with access to its medical aid in dying law.
media.copyright: Sarah Blesener for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Genetics and Heredity;Research;Archaeology and Anthropology;Bones;Skeletons;Colonization;your-feed-science;Reich, David E (1974- );Africa;East Africa
results.title: DNA Confirms Oral History of Swahili People
results.abstract: A genetic analysis of dozens of ancient skeletons from East Africa helps pin down the origins of coastal Swahili society.

media.caption: The ruins of Gede, a medieval Swahili coastal settlement in Kenya where researchers are now searching for the remains of less well-to-do Swahili people.
media.copyright: Marius Dobilas/Shutterstock

results.adx_keywords: Mathematics;Puzzles;Research;your-feed-science
results.title: Elusive ‘Einstein’ Solves a Longstanding Math Problem
results.abstract: And it all began with a hobbyist “messing about and experimenting with shapes.”

media.caption: An “aperiodic monotile,” or einstein, is a shape that tiles an infinite flat surface in a nonrepeating pattern. The authors of a new paper called their einstein “the hat,” as it resembles a fedora.
media.copyright: Craig Kaplan

results.title: Trump’s Return to Fox News Gets a Cool Reception … on Fox News
results.abstract: The network used to be a safe space for the former president. But Brian Kilmeade, Jason Chaffetz and others had tough words for his appearance on “Hannity,” his first Fox interview in months.

media.caption: Fox News and Donald J. Trump existed for years in a kind of symbiosis — with on-air personalities effusively praising him and benefiting from big ratings for his frequent appearances.
media.copyright: Christopher Lee for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate (Commercial);Auctions;Historic Buildings and Sites;Gural, Jeff;Flatiron Building (Manhattan, NY);Flatiron District (Manhattan, NY)
results.title: He Bid $190 Million for the Flatiron Building, Then Didn’t Pay Up
results.abstract: A little-known buyer won an auction and then went off the radar, failing to pay the $19 million deposit. Now the famous building’s fate is uncertain.

media.caption: Mocked after its construction in 1902, the wedge-shaped Flatiron Building became an icon and gave its name to a neighborhood.
media.copyright: Dave Sanders for The New York Times
